sandrotosi:
Hi Mike,
this is a very interesting feature and we're considering adding the patch to our scribe log server instance, but I have a comment :)

AFAIUI once the patch is in, all the paths for a hourly rotated store are split in subdirs, while I see cases where one want to choose to enable this method only in some stores (the ones with more traffic/data) while leaving the default behavior in the others.

So, would you consider adding a config option to enable/disable the "split paths" in the store configuration? I don't have the  coding skills to do that myself, hence why I'm asking :)
. Hi Mike,
this is a very interesting feature and we're considering adding the patch to our scribe log server instance, but I have a comment :)

AFAIUI once the patch is in, all the paths for a hourly rotated store are split in subdirs, while I see cases where one want to choose to enable this method only in some stores (the ones with more traffic/data) while leaving the default behavior in the others.

So, would you consider adding a config option to enable/disable the "split paths" in the store configuration? I don't have the  coding skills to do that myself, hence why I'm asking :)
.

forsberg:
I'm having some trouble getting this to compile, it fails with a link error for SSL functions, which I think is due to it linking in thrift libraries statically.

I solved my immediate problem by adding this patch:

```
diff --git a/configure.ac b/configure.ac
index b13a56b..32a1ecd 100644
--- a/configure.ac
+++ b/configure.ac
@@ -64,6 +64,8 @@ AX_BOOST_BASE([1.36])
 AX_BOOST_SYSTEM
 AX_BOOST_FILESYSTEM

+AC_CHECK_LIB(ssl, SSL_ctrl)
+
 # Generates Makefile from Makefile.am. Modify when new subdirs are added.
 # Change Makefile.am also to add subdirectly.
 AC_CONFIG_FILES(Makefile src/Makefile lib/py/Makefile)
```

..which makes it add -lssl.

Not sure this is the _right_ solution though.
. I'm having some trouble getting this to compile, it fails with a link error for SSL functions, which I think is due to it linking in thrift libraries statically.

I solved my immediate problem by adding this patch:

```
diff --git a/configure.ac b/configure.ac
index b13a56b..32a1ecd 100644
--- a/configure.ac
+++ b/configure.ac
@@ -64,6 +64,8 @@ AX_BOOST_BASE([1.36])
 AX_BOOST_SYSTEM
 AX_BOOST_FILESYSTEM

+AC_CHECK_LIB(ssl, SSL_ctrl)
+
 # Generates Makefile from Makefile.am. Modify when new subdirs are added.
 # Change Makefile.am also to add subdirectly.
 AC_CONFIG_FILES(Makefile src/Makefile lib/py/Makefile)
```

..which makes it add -lssl.

Not sure this is the _right_ solution though.
.

chrisjbray:
As for testing, I just built it and ran it, saw that it connected to a random machine each time I started scribed, I used a slightly modified scribecat to tail a file to it, confirmed it was passing traffic, then killed the scribed on the upstream machine, saw that scribed reconnected to a different upstream, repeated a few times then left it tailing for ~12 hours. As far as I can tell no ill effects.
. I agree, changed to out parameters like the `getService`
. anton-povarov:
this doesn't work when you only have default store, because NetworkStore::copy() never copes serviceList member.
fix:
- store->serviceList = serviceList;
. this doesn't work when you only have default store, because NetworkStore::copy() never copes serviceList member.
fix:
- store->serviceList = serviceList;
